abstract: HSBC’s chief executive, Michael Geoghegan, has threatened to leave his position at the bank after a meeting last week that implied he might be passed over for the role of chairman, two people familiar with the matter told The Financial Times.
snippet: HSBC’s chief executive, Michael Geoghegan, has threatened to leave his position at the bank after a meeting last week that implied he might be passed over for the role of chairman, two people familiar with the matter told The Financial Times.
lead_paragraph: HSBC‘s chief executive, Michael Geoghegan, is considering leaving his position at the bank after a meeting last week that signaled that he might be passed over for the role of chairman, The Financial Times reported, citing two people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: HSBC Chief May Quit if Not Given Chairman Role
